conclusion: Determine the velocity v of the ions after passing through the velocity selector and the charge-to-mass ratio q/m of the ions selected by the magnetic analyzer.
In the velocity selector, the electric field E and magnetic field B are perpendicular to each other and to the direction of the ion's motion.
The forces due to electric and magnetic fields must balance for the ions to pass through undeflected: qE = qvB.
Solving for v gives v = E/B.
The velocity v of the ions after passing through the velocity selector is v = E/B.
In the magnetic analyzer, the ions move in a circular path under the influence of the magnetic field B.
The radius R of the circular path is given by R = mv/qB.
The ions are selected based on their charge-to-mass ratio q/m. For the ions to pass through the magnetic analyzer from M to N, the radius R must lie between R1 and R2.
Substituting v = E/B into the equation gives R1 <= m(E/B)/qB <= R2.
Solving for q/m gives q/m <= E/(B^2 R2) and q/m >= E/(B^2 R1).
The charge-to-mass ratio q/m of the ions selected by the magnetic analyzer is E/(B^2 R2) <= q/m <= E/(B^2 R1).
The final answer for the velocity v of the ions after passing through the velocity selector is v = E/B.
The final answer for the charge-to-mass ratio q/m of the ions selected by the magnetic analyzer is E/(B^2 R2) <= q/m <= E/(B^2 R1).
